title._content: Image taken from page 83 of 'The Tree of Crocston: being a refutation of the fables of the courtship of Queen Marie and Lord Darnley at Crocston Castle, under the yew tree; and of the poet, Robert Burns, carving his name on the yew tree. (Supplement.)'

description._content: Image taken from: Title: "The Tree of Crocston: being a refutation of the fables of the courtship of Queen Marie and Lord Darnley at Crocston Castle, under the yew tree; and of the poet, Robert Burns, carving his name on the yew tree. (Supplement.)" Author: SEMPLE, David - F.S.A Contributor: Mary - Queen of Scots Shelfmark: "British Library HMNTS 10805.e.4.", "British Library HMNTS 10370.ee.15." Cook Issuance: monographic Identifier: 003335648 Note: The colours, contrast and appearance of these illustrations are unlikely to be true to life. They are derived from scanned images that have been enhanced for machine interpretation and have been altered from their originals.
